questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag is used to create the largest heading in HTML. There are six heading tags from <h1> to <h6>.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to provide alternate text for an image?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternate text for images in HTML for accessibility.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag (anchor tag) is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.question: Which property is used to change text color in CSS?
questions.explanation: The color property sets the text color in CSS.

questions.question: Which tag is used to define the document title?
questions.explanation: The <title> tag defines the title of the document that appears in the browser tab.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML document structure?
questions.explanation: The correct structure is <html> as the root element, containing <head> and <body> elements.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a paragraph?
questions.explanation:
The

tag is used to create paragraphs in HTML.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies the source of an image?
questions.explanation: The src attribute specifies the path to the image file.

questions.question: How do you make text bold in HTML?
questions.explanation: Both <b> and <strong> tags can be used to make text bold, with <strong> having semantic importance.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create an unordered list?
questions.explanation: The <ul> tag creates an unordered (bulleted) list in HTML.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create an ordered list?
questions.explanation: The <ol> tag creates an ordered (numbered) list in HTML.

questions.question: Which tag is used for list items?
questions.explanation: The <li> tag defines list items within <ul> or <ol> elements.

questions.question: How do you create a line break in HTML?
questions.explanation:
The
tag creates a line break in HTML.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change background color?
questions.explanation: The background-color property sets the background color of an element.

questions.question: How do you select an element by ID in CSS?
questions.explanation: Use # followed by the ID name to select an element by its ID in CSS.

questions.question: How do you select an element by class in CSS?
questions.explanation: Use . followed by the class name to select elements by their class in CSS.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is used to specify a CSS class?
questions.explanation: The class attribute is used to specify one or more CSS classes for an element.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is used for inline CSS?
questions.explanation: The style attribute is used to apply inline CSS directly to an HTML element.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling HTML documents.

questions.question: What is the CSS box model?
questions.explanation: The CSS box model consists of content, padding, border, and margin areas around every HTML element.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used for spacing inside an element?
questions.explanation: Padding creates space inside an element, between the content and the border.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used for spacing outside an element?
questions.explanation: Margin creates space outside an element, between the element and other elements.

questions.question: What does the CSS 'display: block' property do?
questions.explanation: Display: block makes an element take up the full available width and start on a new line.

questions.question: What does the CSS 'display: inline' property do?
questions.explanation: Display: inline makes elements appear on the same line, only taking up as much width as necessary.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to center text?
questions.explanation: The text-align property is used to set the horizontal alignment of text.

questions.question: What is the difference between id and class attributes?
options: ID is unique, class can be reused
Class is unique, ID can be reused
ID is for CSS, class is for JavaScript
questions.correct_answer: ID is unique, class can be reused
questions.explanation: ID should be unique on a page and used for single elements, while class can be applied to multiple elements.

questions.question: Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the element?
questions.explanation: The 'em' unit is relative to the font-size of the element (1em = current font size).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the DOCTYPE declaration?
questions.explanation: The DOCTYPE declaration tells the browser which version of HTML the document is written in.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the stacking order of elements?
questions.explanation: The z-index property controls the stacking order of positioned elements.

questions.question: What is CSS specificity?
options: The order CSS rules are applied
questions.correct_answer: The order CSS rules are applied
questions.explanation: CSS specificity determines which CSS rules are applied when multiple rules target the same element.

questions.question: Which has higher specificity: ID or class?
questions.explanation: ID selectors have higher specificity than class selectors in CSS.

questions.question: What is the CSS float property used for?
questions.explanation: The float property is used to position elements to the left or right, allowing text to wrap around them.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners?
questions.explanation: The border-radius property is used to create rounded corners on elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS media queries?
questions.explanation: Media queries are used to apply different CSS styles based on device characteristics like screen size.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control element visibility?
questions.explanation: The visibility property controls whether an element is visible (visible/hidden) while keeping its space.

questions.question: What is the difference between 'visibility: hidden' and 'display: none'?
options: Hidden keeps space, none removes space
Hidden removes space, none keeps space
questions.correct_answer: Hidden keeps space, none removes space
questions.explanation: visibility: hidden hides the element but keeps its space, while display: none removes the element entirely.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control text decoration?
questions.explanation: The text-decoration property is used to add decorations like underline, overline, or line-through to text.

questions.question: What is the CSS position property used for?
questions.explanation: The position property specifies the positioning method for an element (static, relative, absolute, fixed, sticky).

questions.question: What is CSS Grid used for?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid is a powerful two-dimensional layout system for creating complex web layouts with rows and columns.

questions.question: What is CSS Flexbox primarily used for?
questions.explanation: CSS Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout method for arranging items in rows or columns with flexible sizing.

questions.question: What are CSS custom properties (variables)?
questions.explanation: CSS custom properties (variables) are defined with -- and allow you to store and reuse values throughout your stylesheet.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'calc()' function used for?
questions.explanation: The calc() function allows you to perform mathematical calculations when specifying CSS property values.

questions.question: What are CSS pseudo-elements?
options: Virtual elements for styling parts of elements
questions.correct_answer: Virtual elements for styling parts of elements
questions.explanation: Pseudo-elements allow you to style specific parts of an element, like ::before, ::after, ::first-letter.

questions.question: What are CSS pseudo-classes?
questions.explanation: Pseudo-classes select elements based on their state, like :hover, :focus, :nth-child().

questions.question: What is the CSS 'transform' property used for?
questions.explanation: The transform property allows you to rotate, scale, translate, or skew elements in 2D or 3D space.

questions.question: What are CSS animations?
questions.explanation: CSS animations allow gradual changes from one set of CSS styles to another using @keyframes.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'transition' property used for?
questions.explanation: The transition property provides smooth changes between different property values over a specified duration.

questions.question: What is CSS specificity calculated based on?
questions.explanation: CSS specificity is calculated based on inline styles (1000), IDs (100), classes/attributes/pseudo-classes (10), and elements (1).

questions.question: What is the CSS 'object-fit' property used for?
questions.explanation: The object-fit property specifies how the content of replaced elements (like images) should fit within their container.

questions.question: What are CSS container queries?
options: Responsive design based on container size
questions.correct_answer: Responsive design based on container size
questions.explanation: Container queries allow you to apply styles based on the size of a containing element rather than the viewport.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'aspect-ratio' property?
questions.explanation: The aspect-ratio property sets a preferred aspect ratio for an element's box.

questions.question: What are CSS logical properties?
questions.explanation: CSS logical properties provide direction-agnostic ways to specify properties based on writing mode and text direction.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS @keyframes rule?
questions.explanation: The @keyframes rule defines the animation sequence by specifying CSS styles at various points during the animation.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'clamp()' function?
options: Setting min, preferred, and max values
questions.correct_answer: Setting min, preferred, and max values
questions.explanation: The clamp() function takes three parameters: minimum, preferred, and maximum values, returning the middle value.

questions.question: What are CSS scroll snap properties?
questions.explanation: CSS scroll snap properties control the snap positions when scrolling through content.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'backdrop-filter' property?
questions.explanation: The backdrop-filter property applies graphical effects like blur or color shift to the area behind an element.

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS subgrid?
options: Grid items participating in parent grid
questions.correct_answer: Grid items participating in parent grid
questions.explanation: CSS subgrid allows grid items to participate in the sizing of their parent grid tracks.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'content-visibility' property?
questions.explanation: The content-visibility property controls whether the browser renders an element's contents, improving rendering performance.
